titleStmt.title: Lovell H. Rousseau to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12196

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
Head Quarters 12th Ky Infty Vols
Strawberry Plains E Tenn
January 10th 1864
To his excellency. Thomas E Bramblette
Govr of Kentucky
Honorable Sir

I have the pleasure of reporting to you that the 12th Ky. I. V. have RE Enlisted as Veteran Vols under the provisions of orders 191' from war Dept or and will march from here on our way to Ky between now and the 1st of February the date of the re Enlistment of the Regt in the Veteran Service will date from the 24th of December 1863. They have re Enlisted under the promise that the Regt will be mounted. I would prefer to make them Cavalry. The order authorizing the RE Enlistment of the Regt as mounted men came from Genl Foster Comdg Dept of the Ohio

I have the honor to be
Very Respectfully,
Your Obt Servt
L H Rousseau
Lt Col Comdg Regt

Hd qrs. 12t Ky Inft Vols.
Strawbeery Plains E. Tenn
10th Jany 1864

Rousseau L. H
Lt Col. Comd
Has the honor to report that the 12th Regt Ky Inft has re enlisted as veterans under provisions of order 191 from War Department
